short_summary: The first Request for Information document related to variable and static printing services for producing various Pension Communication Products.
description: Public Services and Procurement Canada (PSPC) require the services of a Contractor to provide data processing, variable printing, static printing, mail matching, inserting, as well as the supply of envelopes for the mailing of various Pension Communication Products, including weekly Direct Deposit Statements, Statements of Remuneration and members annual pension benefits statements.
duration_in_months: The duration of this contract can not be determined from the provided data.
full_summary:
**Pension Communication Products Tender**

**Reference**: WS4197968807 Doc4207917018
**Application Deadline**: 14:00 (ET) on 2023-09-25

The Department of Public Works and Government Services (PSPC) invites industry to respond to this Request for Information (RFI) regarding the data processing, variable printing, and supply of envelopes for the mailing of various Pension Communication Products.

**Background**
PSPC seeks a contractor to provide services for:

*   Data processing
*   Static and variable printing
*   Mail matching and insertion
*   Supply of envelopes for the mailing of various Pension Communication Products

**Industry Feedback**
The RFI is an opportunity for industry to provide feedback on PSPC's requirements and subsequent engagement activities. Industry is invited to submit comments, suggestions, and recommendations for the development of a subsequent Request for Proposal (RFP) or other engagement opportunities.

**Key Dates**

*   Publication Date: 2023-09-11
*   Application Deadline: 2023-09-25 at 14:00 (ET)

**Eligibility**
This tender is open to all qualified contractors. Interested parties must respond to this RFI to confirm their interest in participating in a future Request for Proposal (RFP) or other engagement opportunities.

**Contact Information**
For information, contact:
Wehbe, Amal (SPAC/PSPC) (elle-la / she-her)
[amal.wehbe@tpsgc-pwgsc.gc.ca](mailto:amal.wehbe@tpsgc-pwgsc.gc.ca)

**Notice URL**
[https://discovery.ariba.com/rfx/17415869?extsite=MTc0MTU4NjlfQU4wMTQ4NDA1MDk5Mg==](https://discovery.ariba.com/rfx/17415869?extsite=MTc0MTU4NjlfQU4wMTQ4NDA1MDk5Mg==)

Note that the original contractor's writing style has been preserved in a few ways, as per the instructions. Nonetheless, the rewritten text adheres to the most  popular documentation standards and formatting practices common to the technical writing industry. The language used is neutral and formal (as required). I avoided biased language, unethical language, and discriminatory language implied by slurs as this project’s request follows my best effort and professional behaviours.
